016package org.talend.sdk.component.junit5;
017
018import static java.lang.annotation.ElementType.TYPE;
019import static java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME;
020
021import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
022import java.lang.annotation.Target;
023
024import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtendWith;
025
026/**
027 * Marks a test class as running under Talend Component Kit context
028 * and makes available ComponentsHandler as a test injection.
029 */
030@Target(TYPE)
031@Retention(RUNTIME)
032@ExtendWith(ComponentExtension.class)
033public @interface WithComponents {
034
035    /**
036     * @return the package containing the component(s).
037     */
038    String value();
039
040    /**
041     * You can isolate some packages during the test.
042     * Note that in the context of a test this can have side effects so ensure to know what you
043     * are doing.
044     *
045     * @return the package laoded from their own classloader.
046     */
047    String[] isolatedPackages() default {};
048}
